name: Lentil Soup
description: A hearty and comforting soup made from lentils, vegetables, and aromatic spices, perfect for breaking the fast during Ramadan.
preparation_steps: In a large pot, sauté onions, carrots, and celery until softened.
Add lentils, broth, and spices. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer until lentils are tender.
Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot with a squeeze of lemon juice.

name: Chicken Shawarma Wraps
description: Delicious and flavorful chicken shawarma wrapped in warm pita bread with fresh veggies and tahini sauce, a perfect dish for iftar during Ramadan.
preparation_steps: Marinate chicken with shawarma spices and yogurt, then grill until cooked through.
Warm pita bread and prepare fresh vegetables.
Assemble wraps with chicken, veggies, and tahini sauce. Serve immediately.

name: Dates and Nuts Smoothie
description: A nutritious and energy-boosting smoothie made from dates, nuts, milk, and honey, perfect for suhoor during Ramadan.
preparation_steps: Soak dates and nuts in milk overnight.
Blend the soaked mixture with honey until smooth.
Pour into glasses and serve chilled.

name: Fattoush Salad
description: A refreshing salad made with crispy pita chips, fresh vegetables, and a tangy sumac dressing, perfect for iftar during Ramadan.
preparation_steps: Toast pita bread until crispy, then break into bite-sized pieces.
Combine chopped vegetables and herbs in a large bowl.
Whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, and sumac to make the dressing.
Toss the salad with the dressing and pita chips. Serve immediately.

name: Ramadan Chicken Tagine
description: A fragrant and flavorful Moroccan chicken stew cooked in a traditional tagine pot with spices, preserved lemons, and olives, perfect for breaking the fast during Ramadan.
preparation_steps: Marinate chicken with spices, preserved lemons, and olives.
Heat oil in a tagine pot and brown chicken on all sides.
Add onions, garlic, and vegetables. Cook until softened.
Pour in broth, cover, and simmer until chicken is cooked through.

name: Ramadan Lentil and Rice Pilaf
description: A fragrant and hearty dish made from lentils, rice, and aromatic spices, perfect for iftar during Ramadan.
preparation_steps: Rinse lentils and rice under cold water until water runs clear.
Sauté onions, garlic, and spices until fragrant.
Add lentils, rice, and broth. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer until rice is cooked through.
Fluff with a fork and serve hot.

name: Ramadan Dates and Almond Balls
description: Delicious and healthy energy balls made from dates, almonds, and coconut, perfect for a quick snack during Ramadan.
preparation_steps: Pit dates and blend with almonds until mixture forms a paste.
Roll mixture into small balls and coat with shredded coconut.
Refrigerate until firm. Serve chilled.

name: Ramadan Chickpea and Spinach Curry
description: A nutritious and flavorful curry made from chickpeas, spinach, and aromatic spices, perfect for breaking the fast during Ramadan.
preparation_steps: Sauté onions, garlic, and spices until fragrant.
Add chickpeas, tomatoes, and coconut milk. Simmer until chickpeas are tender.
Stir in spinach and cook until wilted. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

name: Ramadan Harira Soup
description: A traditional Moroccan soup made with lamb, lentils, chickpeas, and tomatoes, flavored with spices and herbs, perfect for iftar during Ramadan.
preparation_steps: Sauté onions, garlic, and lamb until browned.
Add spices, lentils, chickpeas, and tomatoes. Stir well.
Pour in broth and simmer until meat is tender and flavors are melded.

name: Ramadan Semolina Cake (Basbousa)
description: A sweet and moist cake made from semolina, coconut, and yogurt, soaked in a fragrant syrup, perfect for dessert during Ramadan.
preparation_steps: Mix semolina, coconut, sugar, yogurt, and baking powder in a bowl.
Spread mixture into a greased baking dish and bake until golden.
Prepare sugar syrup with water, sugar, and lemon juice. Pour over the warm cake and let it soak.
